nodes.text: Let's open this thing back up!
Sure, let's get that pirate treasure.
Katie took all the items that open this door. I can't get in without her.
That is a really creepy door.
Yeah. This whole area feels weird. The sooner we figure out how to get this open, the better I'll feel.
Well, there's no obvious keyhole, but there's a depression in the sun and the moon decoration, and that skull shape in the middle.
According to the map, we'll need the Death Head Gems and the Tattooed Skull, so that's probably where they need to go.

I get a sense of unpleasant magic all around here, but there is strong magic on this gate, particularly coming from the three depressions. The Skull Wall is clearly protected and locked shut by the magic.
Well, there is obviously some sort of magic here, but I'm not skilled enough to sense details about the spell.
There's still a strong impression of magic here that holds this gate shut.
The door won't budge. We clearly need to use the items to open the door.
That necklace you always wear - the skull gem looks like it would fit in the small holes of the door.
Okay, yes, but I'm sure a lot of things could fit in that hole. But that still leaves the other hole empty.
Ah, but I came across this necklace hidden away... look familiar?
It's like a mirror image of my gem! My father gave this to me years ago, but never said much about it. It's got to be made for this door!
So let's see what happens when we put the gems in the empty sockets...

options.text: Place the Gem in the Moon Symbol

nodes.text: I'll try placing the skull gem in the moon symbol hole.
There... Nothing seems to happen, though.
I'll try putting my gem in the other hole...
I don't think this is working. You'd think it would do something!
Well, we can try to do it the other way around.

options.text: Place the Gem in the Sun Symbol

nodes.text: I'll place the red gem in the sun symbol.
Ooh, there's an eerie blue glow around the gem now.
Then I'll put my green skull gem in the moon depression.
Yes. Both gems are glowing now!
Okay, so far, so good. It didn't explode or come to life on us... yet.
So I also came across this interesting item on my explorations...
It's a tattooed skull!
So what will happen when I put this skull in the door...
Okay, now I'll put the Tattooed Skull in the door...
That fits perfectly! It's starting to glow.
But the door still won't move.

options.text: Ask Katie to Use the Tattooed Skull

nodes.text: I think you should try putting the Tattooed Skull into the depression.
Okay, I hope it doesn't explode on me...
It fits in place perfectly. It's starting to glow.
But the door still won't move.
Look at that! A keyhole appeared!
The map tells us the Captain's Key unlocks the gate. Go ahead and use the Skeleton Key, Shawn.
It fits! That's it. It's starting to open.
Okay, I'll insert the Captain's Key into the keyhole now. Here goes nothing!
It fits! That's it. It's starting to open.

nodes.message: We need some special effect on the gate, then the gate opening and the scene changing to next room

nodes.text: We have a Skeleton Key, but no obvious keyhole.
The map tells us that the gate unlocks with the Captain's Key, so there must be a hole somewhere.
Didn't you say that you had the key to this gate?
I've got the Captain's Key, but I don't see a keyhole in the door.
Maybe we need to use some of the other items first.
The door won't budge. We clearly need to use something to open the door.
I guess we don't yet have everything we need to open the gate yet.
Yikes, it's a really creepy door. I don't see any keyholes or obvious ways to open it, and it's solidly closed. There are three depressions in the door. One sort of looks like a skull.
I don't know how to open this gate. I probably need to find some items to fill those holes in the door.

I get a sense of unpleasant magic all around here, but there is strong magic on this gate, particularly coming from the three depressions. The Skull Wall is clearly protected and locked shut by the magic.
Well, there is obviously some sort of magic here, but I'm not skilled enough to sense details about the spell.
There's still a strong impression of magic here that holds this gate shut.
I may need help to get past this door.
